properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:42AM EST until January 13 at 12:08PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Driftwood River...Eagle Creek...East Fork White River...Eel River...
Sugar Creek...Tippecanoe River...Wabash River...White River...
Wildcat Creek...


.With rainfall totals between 1 to 1 and a half inches there are
widespread flooding concerns across much of Indiana. Over the next
couple of days we will see another 1 to 3 inches of rain or more
possible.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Sugar Creek at Crawfordsville.
* from Saturday afternoon to Monday afternoon.
* At  7:30 AM Friday the stage was 1.9 feet.
* Flood stage is 8.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Saturday afternoon and
continue to rise to near 12.4 feet by Sunday morning.  It will fall
below flood stage by late Sunday night.
* At 12.0 feet...Residences and SR 234 in northeast Parke County begin
to flood.  Extensive flooding north of Sugar Creek near U.S. 231 is
in progress.  Flooding begins on Crawfordsville Power Plant
grounds.  Extensive agricultural flooding is in progress.
Extensive flooding of low areas of Shades and Turkey Run State
Parks.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
